translation: Northern Liang Tianzhushu Sanzang translated by Dharmakṣema

source_sentence: 檀波羅蜜品第五之三
translation: The Fifth and Third Part of the Chapter on the perfection of giving

source_sentence: 佛告寂意菩薩：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Silent Mind Bodhisattva, Good sons!

source_sentence: 其後復過無量無邊阿僧祇劫，此界轉名選擇諸惡。
translation: After an incalculable, limitless, and incalculably long eon, this realm will be called the bad discrimination of choices.

source_sentence: 爾時大劫名善等蓋，世亦五濁。
translation: At the time, the great eon was called the good and so forth, and the world also had five turbidities.

source_sentence: 東方去此五十四天下，彼閻浮提名盧婆羅。
translation: In the east, there are fifty-four worlds away from here, and that Jambudvīpa is called Rāpāla.

source_sentence: 以願力故，生於彼中作轉輪聖王，主四天下，號虛空淨，教諸眾生安住十善及三乘中。
translation: Because of the power of their vow, they're born there as wheel-turning sage kings who rule over the four continents and are called space pure, teaching sentient beings to abide in the ten good and three vehicles.

source_sentence: 我於爾時布施一切無所分別，是時多有無量乞兒來，從我乞種種珍寶、金銀、琉璃、頗梨、錢貨、青琉璃珠、大青琉璃、火珠摩尼，
translation: At the time, I gave alms without discrimination to anyone.

source_sentence: 所有珍寶少不足言，乞者無量，我於是時即問大臣：『如是珍寶從何處生？』
translation: The amount of treasures they possess is insufficient to be described, and the number of beggars are immeasurable.

source_sentence: 大臣答言：『是諸龍王之所示現，雖有此寶惟供聖王，不能廣及如是乞者。』
translation: The minister replied, 'This is the manifestation shown by the dragon kings, and even though there's this treasure, it's only for the sake of the noble king who can't go as far as such a beggar.'

source_sentence: 「我於爾時作大誓願：『若我未來於五濁中，厚重煩惱，人壽百歲，必定成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: “At that time I made the great vow, saying: If in the future I am deeply afflicted by the five defilements and my life span is one hundred years, I will surely attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 所願成就得己利者，作大龍王，示現種種珍寶之藏，於此選擇諸惡世界，
translation: He who wishes to accomplish his own benefit becomes a great dragon king, manifesting stores of various treasures, choosing bad worlds here.

source_sentence: 在在處處四天下中，於一一天下七返受身，一一身中，示現無量百千萬億那由他等珍寶之藏，
translation: In each of the four continents he manifested in one body as many buddha-bodies as there are atoms in all buddha-fields, displaying hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of trillions of jewel treasures.

source_sentence: 一一寶藏縱廣正等一千由旬，各各充滿種種珍寶，如上所說給施眾生。
translation: Each store of treasure is exactly 1,000 yojanas long and wide, each filled with a variety of rare treasures that are given to sentient beings as described above.

source_sentence: 如我在此一世界中精勤用意，如是次第遍十方如恒河沙等五濁惡世無佛國土，
translation: Just as in this one world I diligently undertake to pervade the ten directions in order, like the sands of the Ganges River and other five turbid bad worlds without buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 於一一佛土一一天下七返受身，乃至如上所說。』
translation: In each Buddha land, he'll receive his body seven times in each of the worlds, up to as much as described above.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我作如是善願。
translation: I've made such a good vow.

source_sentence: 爾時天人有百千億，在虛空中，雨種種華而讚我言：『善哉！
translation: At the time, there were hundreds of thousands of millions of gods and humans in the sky raining various flowers and praising me, saying, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 一切布施，汝今已得，如心所願。』
translation: All the gifts you've given are now obtained, just as you wish.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾聞虛空淨王，諸天作字，號一切施，聞是事已，各各相謂：『我等今者應往乞求難捨之物，
translation: At that time the whole assembly heard the words of the celestial beings called All-giving, saying, “We should go and beg for what is difficult to give up.” Having heard these words, they said to each other:

source_sentence: 若能捨者，可得名為一切布施。
translation: If someone can abandon it, they can be called giving almsgiving for all.

source_sentence: 如其不能，何得稱為一切施也？』
translation: If they can't, how can they be called all kinds of giving?'

source_sentence: 是時諸人各各從王，乞索後宮夫人、婇女及兒息等。
translation: Each of the people then begged the king for a wife, a maid, a child, and so forth from the ladies in the rear palace.

source_sentence: 時轉輪王聞是事已，心大歡喜，隨其所索，悉皆與之。
translation: When the wheel-turning king heard this, he was greatly delighted and gave whatever he asked for.

source_sentence: 是時諸人復更相謂：『如是妻子皆是易捨，非難事也。
translation: The people then again said to each other, 'Such and such wives are all easy to abandon, not difficult things.'

source_sentence: 今當從王乞身支節，若能捨者，真可得名能捨一切。』
translation: Now, I'll beg the king for a bodily limbs, and if he can abandon them, they really can be called capable of abandoning all of them.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，諸人往大王所，於是眾中，有乞兒，字青光明，受持狗戒，向轉輪王作如是言：『大王若是一切施者，
translation: “At that time, the people approached the great king. Thereupon, there was a beggar in the assembly whose name was Vimalakīrti and who had upheld the dog precepts. He said to the wheel-turning king, saying:

source_sentence: 唯願施我此閻浮提。』
translation: Please give me this Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 我時聞已，心大歡喜，尋以香水洗浴其人，令著柔軟上妙衣服，以水灌頂，
translation: Having heard this, I was overjoyed and showered water to the top of my head.

source_sentence: 紹聖王位，持閻浮提即以施之。
translation: He assumed the throne of a sage king, held Jambudvīpa, and gave it to him.

source_sentence: 復作是願：『如我以此閻浮提施，是因緣故，成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Again, they make this vow: 'Suppose I give this gift to Jambudvīpa, which is the cause and condition for attaining unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 所願成就得己利者，是閻浮提所有人民，皆當承順奉敬此人以為王者。
translation: Those who wish to achieve their own benefit will be the people of Jambudvīpa, and they'll all obey and venerate this person as king.

source_sentence: 復令此人壽命無量，作轉輪王。
translation: Again, it will cause this person to have an immeasurable life span and become a wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 我成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已，當與授記一生當得補佛之處。』
translation: After I achieve supreme perfect enlightenment, I'll give you a prediction that in one lifetime you'll attain the place of rebirth as a buddha.'

source_sentence: 「有婆羅門名曰盧志，復來從我乞其兩足。
translation: “There was a Brāhmaṇa named Lohitya who came back to me and begged for his two feet.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，即持利刀，自斷二足，持以施之，施已發願：『願我來世具足當得無上戒足。』
translation: After hearing this, my heart rejoiced, so I took a sharp sword, cut off two legs on my own, gave it to him, and after giving it away, made the vow, 'May I be fully endowed in the future with the feet of the unsurpassed precepts.'

source_sentence: 有婆羅門，名曰牙，復來從我乞索二目。
translation: A Brāhmaṇa named Tooth came back and begged me for my two eyes.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，即挑二目持以與之，施已發願：『願我來世當得具足無上五眼。』
translation: After hearing this, I rejoiced in my heart and picked out two eyes to hold them and gave them to him, and after giving them away, I made the vow, 'May I attain the unsurpassed five eyes in a future life.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，有婆羅門，名淨堅牢，復來從我乞索二耳。
translation: Not long after that, a brahman named Jīvaka again came and begged me to give him two earrings.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，尋自割耳持以施之，施已發願：『願我來世當得具足無上智耳。』
translation: After hearing this, my heart rejoiced, and I cut off my own ears and gave them to him, and after giving them away, I made the vow, 'May I attain unsurpassed wisdom in a future life.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，有尼乾子，名想，復來從我乞索男根。
translation: Not long after that, a Nirgrantha boy named Kauśika came back and begged me to give him the male organ.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，尋即自割持以施之，施已發願：『願我來世成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提得馬藏相。』
translation: After hearing this, I rejoiced in my heart and immediately cut myself up to give it to him, and after giving it away, I made the vow, 'May I attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment in a future life and attain the characteristics of the horse's store.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，復有人來，從我乞索其身血肉。
translation: Soon afterward, another man came and begged me for my blood and flesh.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，即便施之，施已發願：『願我來世具足無上金色之相。』
translation: After hearing this, I rejoiced in my heart and gave it to him, and after giving it away, I made the vow, 'May I be endowed with the unsurpassed golden-colored appearance in future lives.'

source_sentence: 未久之間，有婆羅門，名曰蜜味，復來從我求索二手。
translation: Not long after that, a brāhmaṇa named Maitreya came back and begged me to give him his hand.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生歡喜，右手持刀尋斷左手，作如是言：『今此右手不能自割，
translation: Having heard this, I was overjoyed. Holding a knife in my right hand and cutting off my left hand, I said:

source_sentence: 卿自取之。』
translation: You take it for yourself.'

source_sentence: 作是施已，復發願言：『願我來世具足當得無上信手。』
translation: After making this gift, he then made another vow, saying, 'May I be fully endowed in the future life and attain the unsurpassed faithful hand.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我截如是諸支節已，其身血流，復作願言：『因此施故，必定成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: Having cut off all these knuckles, my blood flowing down my body, I also made another vow, saying: Through this gift you will surely attain anuttarii samyaksarrzbodhi.

source_sentence: 所願成就得己利者，其餘身分重得受者。』
translation: Those who wish to accomplish their own benefit will receive it in the other parts of their bodies.'

source_sentence: 爾時非聖不知思義，諸小王等及諸大臣皆作是言：『咄哉愚人！
translation: It was then that non-holy kings didn't know the meaning of deliberation, and the lesser kings and ministers all said, 'Duh, foolish man!

source_sentence: 如何自割身體支節，令諸自在一旦衰滅，其餘肉摶復何所直？』
translation: How can you cut off your own bodily limbs so that the mastery once weakens and perishes, and what else is there to straighten up with the remaining flesh?'

source_sentence: 是時，大臣即持我身，送著城外曠野塚間，各還所止。
translation: The ministers then took my body and escorted me to the wilderness cemetery outside the city, where they each returned to their lodging.

source_sentence: 時有無量蚊虻蠅等唼食我血，狐狼、野干、鵰鷲之屬，悉來噉肉。
translation: At the time, there were measureless gnats, gadflies, flies, and other creatures that came to eat my blood, and foxes, wolves, wild animals, eagles, and eagles all came to eat meat.

source_sentence: 我於爾時命未斷間，心生歡喜，復作願言：『如我捨於一切自在及諸支節，
translation: At that time, before my life had been cut off, I was overjoyed. Again, I made the vow:

source_sentence: 乃至一念不生瞋恚及悔恨心，若我所願成就得己利者，當令此身，作大肉山，
translation: If I fulfill what I wish to attain my own benefit, I will cause this body to become a great mountain of flesh.

source_sentence: 有諸飲血噉肉眾生，悉來至此，隨意飲噉。』
translation: All the sentient beings who drink blood and flesh come here to drink it as they wish.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，尋有眾生悉來食噉，本願力故，其身轉大高千由旬，縱廣正等五百由旬。
translation: After making this vow, some sentient beings all came to eat and devour it, and because of the power of their original vow, their bodies grew a thousand yojanas high and five hundred yojanas long and wide.

source_sentence: 滿千歲中，以此血肉給施眾生。
translation: When he's a thousand years old, he gives this flesh and blood to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我於爾時所捨舌根，令諸虎狼、鵄梟、鵰鷲食之飽足，以願力故，復生如本，
translation: At that time I relinquished the faculty of tongue and caused all the tigers, wolves, hawks, and eagles to eat it. Through the power of my vow they grew up again just as before.

source_sentence: 假當聚集如耆闍崛山，作是施已，復作是願：『願我來世具足得成廣長舌相。』
translation: Suppose they gather together like Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and make this gift and then make another vow, 'May I in the future be fully endowed with the characteristic of a broad and long tongue.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我時命終在閻浮提，以本願故，生於龍中，作大龍王，名示現寶藏，即於生夜，
translation: At that time I was in Jambudvfpa at the end of my life. Because of my original vow, having been reborn among dragons, I became a great dragon king named Sudarśana (i.e., King Sadāparibhūta).

source_sentence: 示現百千億那由他種種寶藏，自宣令言：『今是分中，多有寶藏，其中具足諸珍異物，
translation: They manifested hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of various treasure treasuries, and proclaimed to themselves, “In this section there are many treasure treasuries, each endowed with all kinds of rare treasures.

source_sentence: 金銀乃至摩尼寶珠。』
translation: It's made of gold, silver, or even maṇi jewels.'

source_sentence: 是諸眾生聞是唱已，各各自恣取諸寶物隨意所用。
translation: After these sentient beings hear this call, each of them freely takes the treasures and uses them as they wish.

source_sentence: 用已具足行十善道，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，或發聲聞辟支佛心。
translation: Having fully practiced the ten good paths, they give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, or they may give rise to the mind of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 我於爾時在龍王中，七返受身，壽命七萬七千億那由他百千歲，示現無量無邊阿僧祇寶藏，
translation: At that time I was among the nāga kings, seven times rebirth as a buddha, with a life span of seventy-seven thousand myriads of koṭis of nayutas of years. I manifested immeasurable, limitless, and incalculable treasure collections.

source_sentence: 與諸眾生。
translation: They're the same as all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 爾時安住無量無邊阿僧祇人於三乘中，勸令具足行十善道，以種種無量珍寶滿眾生已，
translation: At the time, there were countless and limitless incalculable numbers of people living in the three vehicles who were encouraged to fully practice the ten good paths, and after filling sentient beings with various kinds of measureless treasures

source_sentence: 復發願言：『願我來世具足，當得三十二相。』
translation: Again, he made a vow, saying, 'May I be fully endowed in the future life and attain the thirty-two marks.'

source_sentence: 如是第二天下，亦復七生作大龍王，乃至遍滿選擇世界在在處處諸四天下，
translation: In the same way, on the second day he also became a great dragon king for seven more births, filling all the four continents of the universe Sarvarūpasaṃdarśana everywhere.

source_sentence: 悉作如是無量利益。
translation: They all perform such measureless benefits.

source_sentence: 乃至十方無量無邊無佛世界，一一佛界一一天下，亦復七生作大龍王，
translation: In the ten directions, in countless, boundless, and without buddha-worlds, each buddha-realm, each world, he also became a great dragon king for seven more lifetimes.

source_sentence: 壽命七萬七千億那由他百千歲，示現如是無量無邊阿僧祇寶藏，亦復如是。
translation: Their life span is seventy-seven thousand myriads of koṭis of nayutas a hundred thousand years, and they manifest such an immeasurable, limitless, incalculable store of treasure as this one.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今當知，是謂如來為菩薩時，深重精進求三十二相之因緣也。
translation: You should now know that this is the cause and condition for the Tathāgata's profound effort to pursue the thirty-two marks when he was a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 如來為菩薩時，所行精進除上八人，過去世中更無能及。
translation: When the Tathāgata was a bodhisattva, the exertion he practiced excluded the above eight people, and there were no others in the past who could match them.

source_sentence: 若過去無者，當知未來諸菩薩等，亦復不能如是勤行深重精進如我所行。
translation: If they didn't exist in the past, you should know that future bodhisattvas and so forth wouldn't be able to thus diligently practice profound effort as I will.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 復過無量無邊阿僧祇劫，此界轉名珊瑚池，劫名華手，是時無佛，其世五濁。
translation: After another incalculable, limitless, and incalculably long eon, this realm became known as the coral pond, and that eon was called the flower hand, when there were no buddhas and five turbidities in the world.

source_sentence: 我於是中作釋提桓因，名善日光明，觀閻浮提，見諸眾生轉行惡法，我時即化為夜叉像，
translation: At that time I was the lord of the god Śakra, named Sunlight of the Sun of Good. Observing the evolving ways of sentient beings in Jambudvfpa, I transformed myself into the form of a yakṣa.

source_sentence: 其形可畏，下閻浮提住諸人前。
translation: Its form is fearsome, and it descends to Jambudvīpa to stand in front of people.

source_sentence: 諸人見我皆生怖畏，而問我言：『欲何所須？
translation: Seeing me, they all became frightened and asked me, 'What do you need?'

source_sentence: 願速說之。』
translation: May I quickly explain it to you?'

source_sentence: 我時答言：『唯須飲食，更無所須。』
translation: I then answered, 'There's nothing more to need than food and drink.'

source_sentence: 其人復問：『欲食何等？』
translation: The man again asked, 'What do you want to eat?'

source_sentence: 我復答言：『唯殺於人，噉其血肉。
translation: Again, I replied, 'I only kill people and eat their flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 汝等若能盡其形壽持不殺戒，乃至正見，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，若發聲聞、緣覺心者，
translation: If you aspire to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment by upholding the precept of not killing for as long as your bodies can live, and so on, up to right view, if you give rise to the minds of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 我即不復食噉汝等。』
translation: That is, I won't eat and deceive you again.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時常作化人，以供食飲。
translation: At the time, I always created people to provide food and drink for them.

source_sentence: 爾時眾生見我如是，倍生怖畏，悉皆盡形受不殺戒，乃至正見，或發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，
translation: When sentient beings saw me like this, they became even more frightened, and all of them accepted the precept against killing in all their forms up to right view or aspired to unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 或發聲聞、辟支佛心。
translation: Or they may give rise to the minds of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 我勸如是閻浮提內一切眾生，修行十善住三乘已，復作誓願：『若我必成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: “Furthermore, having thus encouraged all sentient beings in Jambudvfpa to cultivate the ten good practices and abide in the three vehicles, I further make this vow:

source_sentence: 所願成就得己利者，復當勸此四天下人令行十善道，乃至遍滿此之世界，
translation: Those who wish to accomplish their own benefit should also encourage the people of these four continents to follow the ten wholesome paths, and so on, until they pervade this world.

source_sentence: 在在處處四天下中，以如是相貌，令諸眾生行十善道，勸化發於三乘之心。
translation: Everywhere in the four continents, they use such appearances to cause sentient beings to practice the ten good paths and encourage the minds of the three vehicles to be inspired.

source_sentence: 如是遍滿一世界已，乃至十方無量無邊阿僧祇等五濁惡世，無佛國土，
translation: “Furthermore, the buddha-lands pervade one world and do not exist in any of the five defiled evil worlds, such as the ten directions.

source_sentence: 亦復如是。』
translation: It's likewise.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時發是願已，一切成就，於珊瑚池世界化作可畏夜叉之像，調伏眾生，
translation: Having made this vow at that time, I accomplished all of them. In the world coral pond I magically created an image of a fearless yakṣa to tame sentient beings.

source_sentence: 令住十善及三乘中。
translation: He causes them to abide in the ten good and three vehicles.

source_sentence: 如是遍於十方無量無邊阿僧祇等五濁惡世，無佛國土，作夜叉像，調伏眾生，
translation: “In the same way they pervade the ten directions in measureless, boundless, and incalculable numbers of such five defiled evil worlds as Jambudvfpa, without buddha-lands, to become like yakṣas, taming sentient beings.

translation: He caused measureless sentient beings to enter the buddha-dharma and receive the three refuges, and then he taught them the teachings of the three vehicles. He also taught the three precepts and showed them the three doors of liberation.

translation: Again, they remove measureless and limitless sentient beings from the three bad destinies and place them in the three good destinies.

source_sentence: 善男子！

source_sentence: 過七日已，十方世界有十二那由他菩薩摩訶薩，至娑婆世界住其山邊，

translation: When the enlightening beings had entered, they saw the vast arrays of the pavilion in the cave. Thereupon, some enlightening beings honored the Buddha with the playful spiritual feet of a lion:

translation: One by one, the bodhisattva sat on the precious throne and listened to the teaching.

source_sentence: 善男子！

source_sentence: 彼佛神力其事如是。
translation: The miraculous powers of those buddhas are like this.

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩得聞法已，尋從坐起，頭面禮佛，右遶三匝，各各還歸本佛世界。
translation: Having heard the Dharma, these bodhisattvas rose from their seats, bowed their heads and faces to the Buddha, circumambulated him three times to his right, and each returned to their own buddha world.

source_sentence: 其去未久，窟還如故。
translation: Not long after his departure, the cave returned to its original state.

source_sentence: 復有壞諸魔佛、娑羅王佛、大力光明佛、蓮華增佛、栴檀佛、彌樓王佛、堅沈水佛、火智大力佛。
translation: Again, there are the Destruction of Māra Buddha, the King of Sāra Buddha, the Great Powerful Light Buddha, the Lotus Sutra Increasing Buddha, the Sandalwood Buddha, the King of Maitreya Buddha, the Firmly Shining Water Buddha, and the Great Powerful Buddha of Fire Knowledge.

source_sentence: 如是無量諸佛如來，乃至北方四維上下，皆亦如是。」
translation: So it is with these measureless buddha-tathāgatas, up to the four squares in the north and down.

source_sentence: 爾時，釋迦牟尼如來，以大神力，為欲容受如是眾故，即一一變來會者身，
translation: At that time the Buddha Śākyamuni, wishing to receive such an assembly of people by means of his great supernatural powers, transformed each and every one of them into the bodies of those who came.

source_sentence: 極令微細如亭歷子，娑婆世界虛空及地，彌滿側塞間無空處乃至一毛。
translation: It's so subtle that it's like a pavilion, and the space and ground of the sahā world are filled with space or even a single hair between the sides.

source_sentence: 時諸眾生各不相見，亦復不見大小諸山、須彌山王、大小鐵圍二國中間幽冥之處，
translation: The sentient beings then did not see each other, nor did they see the great and small mountains, Mount Sumeru, or the two large and small iron enclosures in the middle of the darkness.

source_sentence: 及上諸天所有宮殿，下至不見金剛地際，唯除一人佛世尊也。
translation: And all the palaces of the gods above and below, down to the point where they don't see the adamantine ground, except for one person, the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時，釋迦牟尼如來復入遍虛空斷諸法定意三昧，令此無量月光淨華，
translation: At that time, the Buddha Śākyamuni again entered the concentration pervading space to cut off all thoughts of defilement and cause these pure flowers of infinite moonlight to bloom.

source_sentence: 悉入一切身諸毛孔，一切大眾悉皆自見。
translation: They enter all the pores of their bodies, and all the masses see for themselves.

source_sentence: 爾時，眾生都不憶念佛色身相，唯見毛孔，有妙園觀，其園觀中，有諸寶樹，
translation: At that time the sentient beings did not remember the Buddha’s physical form or bodily features but saw in their hair pores beautiful parks and pavilions. In those parks and pavilions there were many jeweled trees, which looked like buddha-lands to them.

source_sentence: 其樹復有種種莖葉，華果茂盛，種種寶衣、天幡、幢蓋、天冠、寶飾、真珠、瓔珞，
translation: The trees also had various stalks and leaves, abundant with flowers and fruit. They were covered with various jeweled robes, heavenly pennants, canopies, celestial crowns, adorned with precious ornaments, pearls, and jewelry.

source_sentence: 所有莊嚴，譬如西方安樂世界。
translation: Their adornments are like those of the paradise world in the West.

source_sentence: 是諸大眾見是事已，復作思惟：「今我當往遊觀彼園。」
translation: Seeing this, the crowd of people again thought, Now, I'll go and visit that park.

source_sentence: 爾時，唯除三惡眾生及無色天，其餘所有一切大眾，皆從毛孔入如來身，
translation: At that time, except for the three evil sentient beings and the formless gods, all the other great assemblies entered the body of the enlightened one from his pores.

source_sentence: 處園而坐。
translation: He sat in the garden.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來還捨神足，時諸大眾各各還得如本相見，各相謂言：「如來今者為在何處？」
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata returned and abandoned his miraculous legs, and each of the assembled people saw themselves as before, each saying, Where is the Tathāgata now?

source_sentence: 爾時，彌勒菩薩告諸大眾：「汝等當知，我今與汝等，悉在如來身分之中。」
translation: At the time, Maitreya addressed the masses, You should know that I'm now with you, and they're all within the Tathāgata's identity.

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾即見如來身之內外，尋自覺知與無量大眾集聚，共處如來身中，
translation: At that moment, the great assembly saw both inside and outside of the body of the enlightened one. Having perceived it for themselves, they assembled together with an infinite number of great assemblies to live together in the body of the enlightened one.

source_sentence: 復相謂言：「我等為從何處得入？
translation: Again, they said to each other, Where can we enter?

source_sentence: 誰將導我令入是中？」
translation: Who will guide me into this?

source_sentence: 彌勒菩薩復告之曰：「諦聽！
translation: Maitreya then again told him, Listen closely!

source_sentence: 諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 如來今者現大神通變化之力，復為利益我等大眾將欲說法，仁等今當一心專念。」
translation: Now that the Tathāgata has manifested the power of great miraculous transformation, he's also benefiting the masses of us who are about to teach the Dharma, so you should now concentrate your minds on it.

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾聞是語已，長跪合掌，受教而聽。
translation: After hearing these words, the crowd knelt down with their palms joined and listened as instructed.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以一切行門而演說法：「何等名為一切行門？
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān explained the teaching through the gate of all practices, What's called the gate of all practices?

source_sentence: 出生死淤泥，入八聖道，具足成就得一切智。
translation: They are born in the mud of birth-and-death, enter the eight noble paths, and fully accomplish omniscience.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 有十專心發於菩提，能入是門。
translation: There are ten kinds of people who focus their minds on enlightenment and can enter this approach.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are these ten?

source_sentence: 一者欲令眾生悉得解脫，迴向隨喜故；
translation: The first is to cause all sentient beings to attain liberation, because they dedicate themselves back and forth with joy.

source_sentence: 二者發大悲心攝眾生故；
translation: The second is to give rise to great compassion and embrace sentient beings.

source_sentence: 三者欲度未度，精勤修治無上法船故；
translation: The third is the determination to save those who have not yet saved, because they diligently cultivate and practice the supreme ship of teaching.

source_sentence: 四者欲解未解者莊嚴，觀脫於虛妄顛倒故；
translation: The fourth is the adornment of wanting to understand and those who do not understand, because they contemplate liberation from falsehood and delusion.

source_sentence: 五者欲師子吼無所怖畏莊嚴，觀於諸法性無我故；
translation: The fifth is the adornment of wishing for the lion’s roar and being fearless, because they contemplate that the essence of all things is selfless.

source_sentence: 六者欲隨所到一切世界心無分別，善學諸法，同十喻故；
translation: The sixth is nondiscriminating mind in all worlds wherever one wishes to go, learning the principles well because they are the same as the ten metaphors.

source_sentence: 七者欲得光明莊嚴世界，修治戒聚，令清淨故；
translation: The seventh is to attain the world Adorned with Light, wishing to cultivate the collection of precepts so as to make them pure.

source_sentence: 八者成就莊嚴如來十力，具足一切波羅蜜故；
translation: The eighth is the accomplishment of adorning the ten powers of buddhas, endowed with all transcendent ways.

source_sentence: 九者成就莊嚴四無所畏，如說而作故；
translation: The ninth accomplishes the adornment of the four fearlessnesses, because they are done as has been said.

source_sentence: 十者莊嚴十八不共之法，隨所聞法悉得無餘，不放逸故。
translation: Tenth, they adorn themselves with the eighteen unique qualities of enlightening beings and are able to hear all the teachings without exception, because they do not indulge in idleness.

source_sentence: 是名十法專心，發於無上菩提，則能入是一切行門，即得不退無上菩提、無相行門、智道行門，
translation: These are the ten kinds of enlightenment that can be entered by one who concentrates his mind on unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 一切法無我心、無思惟，不生不滅，是名菩薩不退轉地。
translation: All dharmas lack self, mind, and thought, and they don't arise or cease, which is called the bodhisattva's stage of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 以是故，非退非不退，非斷非常，非定非亂。」
translation: Because of this, it's neither retrogressing nor non-backsliding, neither cut off nor eternal, neither determined nor disturbed.

source_sentence: 說是法時，如來腹內八十億恒河沙等菩薩摩訶薩，得不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: When he taught this teaching, the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas as numerous as eighty billion Ganges Rivers in the belly of the Tathāgata attained unregressing anuttara samyaksarrzbodhi.

source_sentence: 不可數菩薩摩訶薩得諸三昧甚深法忍，悉從如來身毛孔出，心大驚怪，
translation: Countless great enlightening beings and bodhisattvas, having attained the profound tolerance of the principle of samādhi, all emerged from the pores of the Buddha’s body in great wonder.

source_sentence: 歎未曾有。
translation: He praises what's unprecedented.

source_sentence: 即於佛前，頭面著地，為佛作禮，起已忽然各還十方本佛世界，復聞釋迦牟尼如來所演音聲，
translation: They bowed to the Buddha with their heads and faces touching the ground in front of him. Having paid homage to him, they rose up and immediately returned to their respective buddha-worlds in the ten directions, where they each heard the voice of the Buddha Śākyamuni:

source_sentence: 過十方無量無邊阿僧祇等諸佛世界，無諸障閡。
translation: Beyond the measureless, limitless, and incalculable buddha worlds of the ten directions, there are no obstacles or hindrances.

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩雖還彼界，續聞如來所演音教，章句義味無所減少，如在佛前，
translation: “Those bodhisattvas, even though returning to that world, continue to hear the teachings of the buddhas’ voices, never diminishing in their number of syllables, phrases, meanings, and flavors, just as if they were present before a buddha.

source_sentence: 近聽無異。
translation: There's no difference between those who are close to and those who hear it.

source_sentence: 身亦如是，遍諸十方無量世界。
translation: The body is also like this, pervading measureless worlds in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 亦有無量無邊阿僧祇菩薩、聲聞，亦見毛孔出入無礙。
translation: Also there are immeasurable, limitless, and incalculable bodhisattvas and śrāvakas who see their pores coming and going without obstruction.

source_sentence: 如是第二，乃至一切一一毛孔出入無礙，十方世界亦如是。
translation: Thus, this is the second, up to the point where all the pores of each hair emerge and enter without obstruction, and so are the worlds in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾從釋迦如來毛孔中出，頭面禮佛，右繞三匝，住於佛前，以種種音聲而讚歎佛。
translation: At the time, the great assembly emerged from the pores of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni's hair, bowed their heads and faces to the Buddha, circumambulated him three times to his right, stood in front of him, and praised him with various sounds.

source_sentence: 爾時，欲界、色界諸天，雨種種華、塗香、末香、幢幡、瓔珞，微妙技樂供養如來。
translation: At the time, the gods of the desire realm and form realm rained various flowers, coated incense, powdered incense, banners, streamers, jewelry, and subtle tricks to make offerings to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 爾時，會中有一菩薩名無畏等地，長跪叉手，前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, there was a bodhisattva named fearless and so forth in the assembly who knelt down with his palms joined and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是大經當名何等？
translation: What's the name of such a great sūtra?

source_sentence: 云何奉持？」
translation: How do you consecrate it?

source_sentence: 佛告無畏等地菩薩：「是經當名『解了一切陀羅尼門』，亦名『無量佛』，
translation: The Buddha told the bodhisattvas of fearlessness and so forth, This sūtra will be called 'understanding all dhāraṇī teachings' and also called 'countless buddhas.'

source_sentence: 亦名『大眾』，亦名『授菩薩記』，亦名『四無所畏出現於世』，亦名『一切諸三昧門』，
translation: They're also called'masses,' they're also called 'giving the bodhisattva assurance of assurance,' they're also called 'four fearless appearances in the world,' and they're also called all the samādhi-gates.

source_sentence: 亦名『示現諸佛世界』，亦名『猶如大海』，亦名『無量』，亦名『大悲蓮華』。」
translation: It's also called'manifesting the buddha worlds,' it's also called 'like the ocean,' it's also called 'unlimited,' and it's also called 'lotus of great compassion.'

source_sentence: 無畏等地菩薩摩訶薩復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The fearless bodhisattva Mahāsattva again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，受持是經，讀誦通利，為他人說，乃至一偈，得幾所福？」
translation: If there are good men and good women who memorize this sūtra, recite it for the benefit of others, teach it to others, or even one verse, how much merit will they attain?

source_sentence: 佛告無畏等地菩薩：「我已先說所得福德，今當為汝更略說之。
translation: The Buddha told the bodhisattvas of fearlessness and so forth, I've already explained the merits they've attained, but now I'll explain them briefly for you.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人若有受持是經，讀誦通利，為他人說，乃至一偈，於後五十歲中，
translation: Good men and good women who preserve this scripture, recite it for the benefit of all, and teach it to others. For fifty years from now, even if they do so for a single verse, they will attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 乃至有能書寫一偈，所得功德勝諸菩薩十大劫中行六波羅蜜。
translation: Even if there's someone who can write a single verse, the merit they attain is superior to that of bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections for ten great eons.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 諸天魔、梵、沙門、婆羅門、夜叉、羅剎、龍、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、拘辦荼、餓鬼、毘舍遮、人及非人，
translation: The god Māra, Brahma, ascetics, renunciants, brahmans, brahmans, yakṣas, rāṣṭrapālas, nāgas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, kācaṇḍas, hungry ghosts, viśācīs, humans, and nonhumans.

source_sentence: 有瞋恚心者，聞是經已，即得清淨、柔軟、歡喜，而離諸病、忿怒、怨賊，
translation: If someone with an angry mind hears this sutra, they’ll attain purity, gentleness, and joy, and be free of illness, anger, and enemies.

source_sentence: 種種鬪諍，消滅一切暴風惡雨，病者得愈，飢渴者得飽滿，受諸快樂，
translation: All kinds of disputes and quarrels are extinguished, and all the storms and bad rainstorms are eliminated. Those who are ill are cured, those hungry and thirsty are satisfied, and they experience various pleasures.

source_sentence: 和合相順。
translation: They are combined and concomitant.

source_sentence: 瞋恚之者，能令忍辱。
translation: Those who are angry can cause them to tolerate it.

source_sentence: 怖畏者無所畏怖，受諸歡樂。
translation: Fearlessness is the absence of fear, which brings happiness.

source_sentence: 有煩惱者令離煩惱，能令善根一切增長，能拔惡道所有眾生，能示三乘出要之路，
translation: Those with afflictions cause them to be freed from afflictions. They can cause all roots of goodness to grow, able to pull out sentient beings in the woeful states and show them the path of liberation of the three vehicles.

source_sentence: 能得甚深法忍三昧陀羅尼門，能與眾生作大利益，能坐道場金剛之座，
translation: He was able to attain the profound dhāraṇī of the samādhi-samādhi of forbearance in regard to all phenomena, and he was able to work for the great benefit of sentient beings. He was able to sit on the adamantine throne of the seat of enlightenment site.

source_sentence: 能破四魔，能示一切助菩提法，能轉法輪。
translation: They can destroy the four demons, show all the factors that aid in enlightenment, and turn the wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 無聖財者能令具足，能令無量無邊眾生入無畏城。
translation: The absence of noble possessions can make them complete, and they can cause measureless and limitless sentient beings to enter the city of fearlessness.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，能持此經，讀誦通利，為他人說乃至一偈，若後末世五十歲中，
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, they can preserve this sūtra, recite it for the benefit of all, and teach it to others as long as one verse.

source_sentence: 乃至有能書寫一偈，得如是等無量無邊福德之聚。
translation: Even if someone can write a single verse, they'll attain such an immeasurable and limitless stock of merit.

source_sentence: 是故我今說如是經，如是大經當付囑誰？
translation: Therefore, I now teach such a sūtra, and who will entrust such a great sūtra to?

source_sentence: 誰能於後五十歲中護持是法？
translation: Who will be able to preserve this teaching for the next fifty years?

source_sentence: 誰能與諸在在處處不退菩薩宣說令聞？
translation: Who can explain it to the nonretrogressing bodhisattvas everywhere and cause them to hear it?

source_sentence: 誰復能為行非法、欲惡、貪邪見、不信善惡，有果報者，演布是教？」
translation: Who else can expound this teaching for the sake of practicing what's unlawful, sexual misconduct, craving and wrong views, or not believing in good and bad things that have results?

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾皆知佛心。
translation: At that point, the masses all knew the Buddha's mind.

source_sentence: 於時有一大仙夜叉，名無怨沸宿，坐於眾中。
translation: At the time, there was a great sage yakṣa named Sunetra of No Enmity and Boiling Constellation sitting among the crowd.

source_sentence: 爾時彌勒菩薩摩訶薩即從坐起，將是夜叉至於佛所。
translation: It was then that Maitreya, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva, rose from his seat and led the night-shark to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是時如來告是夜叉大仙：「汝今當受是經，乃至末後五十歲中，為不退菩薩，
translation: The Tathāgata then said to the great sage Yakṣa, “You should accept this sutra.

source_sentence: 乃至不信善惡報者，演布是教。」
translation: Even someone who doesn't believe in the results of good and bad actions will expound this teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時，夜叉即白佛言：「我於過去八十四大劫中，以本願故，作仙夜叉，
translation: It was then that the yakṣa said to the Buddha: During the past eighty-four great world ages, because of my original vow I became a holy yakṣa.

source_sentence: 修行阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，爾時教化無量無邊阿僧祇人，安止於四無量心，
translation: He cultivated the practice of unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment, and at that time he led and inspired immeasurable, boundless, incalculable numbers of people to abide in the four immeasurable states of mind.

source_sentence: 復令無量無邊眾生不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: It also causes measureless and limitless sentient beings not to regress from unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今當為未來之世一切眾生作擁護故，於後末世五十歲中，受持是經，
translation: I will preserve this scripture for the sake of all sentient beings in future ages. At the end of my life, fifty years from now,

source_sentence: 乃至從他聞四句偈，要當讀誦悉令通利，流布與人，令不斷絕。」
translation: Even if you hear four-line verses from others, you must recite them so that they'll all be shared and disseminated with others without stopping.

source_sentence: 佛說是經已，寂意菩薩、諸天大眾、乾闥婆等、人及非人，皆大歡喜，
translation: And as soon as the Buddha had discoursed thus, the bodhisattva Silent Mind, the great assembly of devas, gandharvas, humans, and nonhumans all rejoiced greatly.

source_sentence: 頭面作禮，退坐而去。
translation: He bowed his head and face, withdrew to his seat, and departed.

translation: Compassionate Flower Scripture, Volume 10
